instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: This board has problems when external Display is hooked up to Thunderbolt port. Internal and external displays stay black until you close and open the lid a few times. Then they both work properly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
Do you have original 85W charger?
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal when the screen is black.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
I?m not sure what customer uses.  I do have 85W. 
I only have board and display for this one. I guess <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> won?t work without housing or I could use a magnet somewhere?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
You don't need to trigger lid sensor.
Just check if its signal remains steady high.

Lid sensor is located on J5250, near audio connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: Sorry, wrong information. Just got the board in front. It actually doesn't show picture when starting, but it does when lid is closed and opened a couple of times, while Thunderbolt is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
Does it have High Sierra OSX installed?
If yest, test it with El Capitan.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: No internal SSD at the moment. I'm testing with an external drive with High Sierra. Should I install El Capitan on it? How about SMC reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
You can try PRAM and SMC reset too.
Don't you have a preinstalled USB pen with El Capitan?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: Not yet, but I do have one drive with it which could be put into external housing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.42V with display only connected, outside the housing. 

SMC and PRAM no luck.

Do I still have to try El Capitan? I don't see how that would be connected to no image and no backlight. I would be happy with a question mark folder screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
Some backlight issues have been reported for High Sierra...
You don't lose anything by trying.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
Sure. I'll go ahead and try.

How about the quesiton mark folder? Should it always be there independent of OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
I tried with El Capitan. Nothing on screen.

Laptop starts with black screen, nothing can be seen using flashlight.

For backlight <SIGNAL>LCD_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is missing. Goes straight to <CHIP>U9100</CHIP> (eDP MUX sheet). So something with MUX then since I see HDMI and DP involved on this sheet?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: Any ideas maybe? Board is super clean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
Do you always get normal image on internal LCD?
The problem appears only when external monitor is connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: No. In order to get image on internal display, external has to be connected and lid closed/open a few times. Then it works normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
Understood now.
For the repair, continue with internal LCD only.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and voltage for pins 28-30 of J9000.
In the first few seconds, you must get 5V there; even without LCD connected.
If LCD is connected, <SIGNAL>LCD_HPD</SIGNAL> should go high.
Once LCD is recognized by PCH, all these should stay high and also image/backlight must come on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: This sounds like <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> tbh...resolder it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.4V
J9000 no voltage on pins 28-30, with or without screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: Tried to reflow/resolder <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: I ended up reflowing only MUX. Computer works normal so far... I guess marked as solved?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A doesn't work properly with external display
threads.message: Run heaven on it at least few hours...
